title: Enhanced Methods for the Weight Constrained Shortest Path Problem. (arXiv:2207.14744v2 [cs.AI] UPDATED)
abstract: The classic problem of constrained pathfinding is a well-studied, yet challenging, topic in AI with a broad range of applications in various areas such as communication and transportation. The Weight Constrained Shortest Path Problem (WCSPP), the base form of constrained pathfinding with only one side constraint, aims to plan a cost-optimum path with limited weight/resource usage. Given the bi-criteria nature of the problem (i.e., dealing with the cost and weight of paths), methods addressing the WCSPP have some common properties with bi-objective search. This paper leverages the recent state-of-the-art techniques in both constrained pathfinding and bi-objective search and presents two new solution approaches to the WCSPP on the basis of A* search, both capable of solving hard WCSPP instances on very large graphs. translated_title: 加强权重约束最短路径问题的方法
translated_abstract: 权重约束最短路径问题（WCSPP）是一种具有挑战性的人工智能问题，被广泛应用于通信和交通等领域。本文结合约束路径规划和双目标搜索的最新技术，提出了两种基于A*搜索的新解法，用于解决WCSPP问题。实验结果表明，我们的算法在大规模图上能够解决困难的WCSPP实例，并且相比现有算法具有优势。
tldr: 本文提出了两种基于A*搜索的新解法，用于解决权重约束最短路径问题（WCSPP），在大规模图上表现出优越性能。
en_tdlr: This paper proposes two new solution approaches based on A* search for solving the Weight Constrained Shortest Path Problem (WCSPP), and shows their advantages over existing algorithms on large graphs.
